column4: Hi friends ,  i need to install libc6 .. when i do any apt-get install, it is giving "The package libc6 needs to be reinstalled, but I can't find an archive for it." ... since apt-get is broken, can i do it via dpkg -i OR what is the best way to install libc6
dpkg -i would be the easiest method (assuming it works, it may not).  You can download the deb file from packages.ubuntu.com (find the package, then scroll down and pick your arch)
just in case, if dpkg -i doesn't work ; is there any other way ? or its only option ?
You can manually extract the files into your filesystem via a liveCD or whatnot.  This isn't pretty, but then again, getting rid of libc6 in the first place is bound to cause some grief :)
